ARABIC: فَٱسْتَخَفَّ قَوْمَهُۥ فَأَطَاعُوهُ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ قَوْمًا فَٰسِقِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: In that way he swayed his people and they succumbed to him. They were a people of deviators.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Thus he made light (of the matter) to his people, and they obeyed him. They were certainly wicked.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: He incited his people to levity and they obeyed him. Surely they were an iniquitous people.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Thus, he made dimwits out of his people and they followed him. They, certainly, were a sinful people. When they invoked Our anger,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: So when he had brainwashed his people, they followed him; indeed they were a disobedient nation.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Thus he fooled his people, and they obeyed him. Verily, they were ever a people who were rebellious.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: So he incited his people to levity and they obeyed him: surely they were a transgressing people.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: So he made his people unsteady, and they obeyed him; surely they were an ungodly people.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Thus he persuaded his people to make light (of Moses), and they obeyed him. Lo! they were a wanton folk.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: In this way he fooled his people and they obeyed him: they were a rebellious people.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Then he incited his people and they obeyed him; verily they were ever a transgressing people.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Thus did he mislead his people and they obeyed him. Indeed, they were a transgressing lot.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Thus did he make fools of his people, and they obeyed him: truly were they a people rebellious (against Allah).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Thus he [Fir'aun (Pharaoh)] befooled and misled his people, and they obeyed him. Verily, they were ever a people who were Fasiqun (rebellious, disobedient to Allah).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: He (Pharaoh) intimidated his nation, so they obeyed him, for they were a sinning nation.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Thus he fooled his people, and they obeyed him. They were wicked people.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: So he bluffed his people, and they obeyed him. Indeed, they were [themselves] a people defiantly disobedient [of Allah].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [43:54] Thus did he, Pharaoh, persuade, incite, his people and they obeyed him, in his wish that Moses be denied. They were truly an immoral folk.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Thus he persuaded his people) the Copts (to make light (of Moses), and they obeyed him) in what he said. (Lo! they were a wanton folk) they were disbelieving folk. 570
